body:
I think this is a tricky thing to fix without breaking backwards compatibility in some way. As is, this patch breaks it for anything that includes `ActiveModel::Serialization` but not `ActiveModel::Serialization::JSON` -- as indicated by the the change you had to make in serialization_test.rb.

Now, I'm not sure why anyone would be doing that, as `ActiveModel::Serialization` is not that useful on its own. And because `ActiveModel::Serialization::XML` doesn't even end up using `serializable_hash`, I'm not sure what purpose `serializable_hash` serves that wouldn't be served by `as_json` directly doing what `serializable_hash` does. In other words, it looks like an abstraction that needlessly increases the API surface area without providing much of a benefit. So maybe we should break BC -- and remove `serializable_hash` entirely (or alias it to `as_json` and deprecate it).
